meanings.definition: The quality or state of being ineducable.
meanings.sent1: Her ineducability made it challenging for the teacher to help her learn new concepts.
meanings.sent2: The ineducability of the wild animals made it impossible for them to be trained.
meanings.sent3: Despite his ineducability in math, he always found a way to excel in other subjects.
meanings.sent4: The ineducability of the old tree stump reminded him of the stubbornness of some people.
meanings.sent5: The ineducability of the rock formations left the geologists puzzled.

meanings.definition: The inability to be educated or taught.
meanings.sent1: The student's ineducability was a barrier to his academic progress.
meanings.sent2: The ineducability of the feral cat made it impossible for anyone to tame it.
meanings.sent3: The ineducability of the computer frustrated the user who couldn't figure out how to operate it.
meanings.sent4: Her ineducability in art class was like trying to teach a fish to climb a tree.
meanings.sent5: The ineducability of the stubborn old mule made the farmer chuckle.
